thread.title: First Mulayam Singh Yadav family daughter takes electoral plunge
thread.title_full: First Mulayam Singh Yadav family daughter takes electoral plunge - The Times of India

author: Faiz Rahman Siddiqui
title: First Mulayam Singh Yadav family daughter takes electoral plunge
text:
KANPUR: After sons and daughters-in-law, SP boss Mulayam Singh Yadav's clan has finally launched its first daughter into electoral politics. Sheela, sister of Badaun MP Dharmendra and niece of Mulayam, has been elected to zila panchayat.
"Sheela and Mulayam's brother-in-law Ajant Singh have been declared elected unopposed as members of Mainpuri district development council (DDC) and Etawah block development council (BDC) respectively in the ongoing panchayat elections," party sources told TOI on Saturday.
Along with Mulayam's nephew Abhishek Yadav alias Anshul, daughter-in-law Mridula and Ajant, Sheela is the nineteenth member of the Yadav clan to enter active politics. "With these new entrants from Yadav clan in this panchayat election, Mulayam now presides over probably the largest political family in the country," said a party leader from Etawah.
"Renu Devi, Sharmishta and Hamida Begum, who had filed nominations for the post of DDC members from Mainpuri's ward 18 from where Sheela was in fray, decided to withdraw their candidature in her favour. She will now contest for the post of zila panchayat chairperson," said Etawah district president Ashok Yadav.
"Similarly, Ajant too was declared elected unopposed from both Gangapura Bithauli and Chaubiya Kalyanpur seats for the post of BDC member as no other candidate had filed nomination from these two seats," Ashok said.
On October 8, Abhishek who is an MBA graduate was declared elected unopposed as the district development council (DDC) member from Saifai ward-II.
Mulayam's daughter-in-law and RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's 'samdhin' (daughter's mother-in-law) Mridula Yadav was declared elected as block development council (BDC) member unopposed from Etawah's Saifai gram sabha ward-X on October 6. Mridula's son Tej Pratap Singh Yadav is currently Mainpuri MP.
"We are winning because we talk about development and also Netaji's (Mulayam) adherence to 'samajwad' (socialism), which has made inroads in every house-hold of Mainpuri. People are buying that concept," Dharmendra said.
Dharmendra said, "We are not contesting elections for ourselves, but for you all. Under Netaji's guidance we want to do something worthwhile for the people."
Meanwhile party sources said that Dharmendra's brother-in-law Anugyesh Pratap Singh Yadav is also contesting for DDC membership from ward no. 2 of Firozabad district.
Six other members of the Yadav clan including Mulayam, his daughter-in-law Dimple, nephew Dharmendra, grand-nephew Tej Pratap, cousin Ram Gopal and his son Akshay Yadav have representation at the national level.
Similarly, eight others including Mulayam's son Akhilesh, his younger sibling Shivpal, latter's son Aditya Pratap and wife Sarla, his sister-in-law Prem Lata, his another nephew Anurag Yadav, Arvind Yadav and his nephew late Ranveer Singh took plunge in state and local level politics.
